Posts.Content: I am on Femara and having joint pain.  My oncologist is suggesting switching to Aromasin but reading these posts it sounds like the side effects are the same.  I have three more years on this drug.  My question for everyone is does this pain go away once you go off the drug?  I think I can handle it for three years if I know it will be gone once I can go off them but if it is causing permanent damage that is another story.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: I started on Tamoxifen and hated the hot flashes and the bloating.  I was so uncomfortable in my body.  So I switched to Femara (now Letrozole).  Joint pain was bad and I got baker's cysts behind my knees.  I have now been on Letrozole for almost 2 years and either I have gotten used to it or the pain has just lessened.  I am still very stiff and have a very hard time standing and/or walking when I just get up from sitting.  In the morning I am unable to walk so the first thing i do is 20 pushups against my dresser and stretch my legs for 5 minutes.  It really helps so I recommend it.  Still have the hot flashes and the baker's cysts - very attractive!
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Has anyone tried Glutamine to alleviate the pain from taking Femara?  Is there any contra-indications for taking the two together?  My chiropracter suggested it.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Does anyone know if it interferes with Femara?
